TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LinkWithAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: A LinkWith attribute specifies how the native library associated with the assembly should be linked to the resulting application.

remarks.para: This attribute is only useful for assemblies that bind to native libraries.

When using this attribute, the specified library in the constructor will be linked with the final application. You can use one or more of the properties of the attribute to configure how the linking is done.

example.code:
// The following is used to link with GoogleAdMobAds:
[assembly: LinkWith ("libGoogleAdMobAds.a", LinkTarget.Simulator | LinkTarget.ArmV7, ForceLoad = true, Frameworks = "AudioToolbox MessageUI SystemConfiguration CoreGraphics MediaPlayer StoreKit", WeakFrameworks = "AdSupport", IsCxx = true, LinkerFlags = "-lz -lsqlite3")]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string libraryName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the native library. For example: libMyLibrary.a
Docs.summary: Creates a new LinkWithAttribute for the specified native library.
Docs.remarks: The library name should be unique as it will become the resource name for the native library embedded in the built assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string libraryName, valuetype MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.LinkTarget target) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the native library. For example: libMyLibrary.a
The target platform (or platforms) that this library is built for.
Docs.summary: Creates a new LinkWithAttribute for the specified native library targetting the specified platform(s).
Docs.remarks: The library name should be unique as it will become the resource name for the native library embedded in the built assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: public LinkWithAttribute (string libraryName, MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.LinkTarget target, string linkerFlags);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string libraryName, valuetype MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.LinkTarget target, string linkerFlags) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the native library. For example: libMyLibrary.a
The target platform (or platforms) that this library is built for.
Additional linker flags that are required for linking the native library to an application.
Docs.summary: Creates a new LinkWithAttribute for the specified native library targetting the specified platform(s).
Docs.remarks: The library name should be unique as it will become the resource name for the native library embedded in the built assembly.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not the -force_load gcc argument is required when linking this native library.
Docs.value: This value should be set to true if the -force_load argument is required, or false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Specifies a space-delimited list of platform Frameworks required by the native library.
Docs.value: This value should be set to a string containing a space-delimited list of platform Frameworks (e.g. "CoreGraphics CoreLocation CoreMedia MediaPlayer QuartzCore").

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not the native library is a C++ library.
Docs.value: This value should be set to true if a c++ compiler should be used when building the application consuming this native library.

Docs.summary: The name of the native library.
Docs.value: A string representing the name of the native library.
Docs.remarks: The library name should be unique as it will become the resource name for the native library embedded in the built assembly.

Docs.summary: Additional linker flags that are required for linking the native library to an application.
Docs.value: A string containing the extra linker flags to be passed to gcc or null if unneeded.

Docs.summary: The target platform (or platforms) that this library is built for.
Docs.remarks: Native libraries can target multiple platforms (often called Fat Binaries).

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not the native library requires linking with the GCC Exception Handling library (libgcc_eh).
Docs.value: This value should be set to true if the native library requires linking with -lgcc_eh, or false otherwise.

Docs.summary: If this is set true, the ForceLoad value will be ignored when it is deemed safe to do so.
Docs.value: This value should be set to true to let Xamarin.iOS determine whether ForceLoad is required or not.
Docs.remarks: In the current implementation the ForceLoad flag is usually not required when the static registrar is used at compilation time. The exact logic is however an implementation detail and may change in future versions.

Docs.summary: Specifies a list of space-delimited platform Frameworks that should be weakly linked.
Docs.value: This value should be set to a string containing a space-delimited list of platform Frameworks (e.g. "CoreBluetooth NewsstandKit Twitter").
